data: For queries, suggestions and issues, drop an email at k.suryawanshi@gmail.com
data.note#Note: Make sure you are using the latest version of the app when reporting any problems. You can click here to check if there is an app update available.

data:
Quick Note is a Menubar app that runs in the background. Unlike other apps, Quick Note does not quit simply by closing all the windows.You can quit the app by following the steps mentioned below
Open the main menu
Select More
Tap on Quit

Open App Settings
Select iCloud Sync tab
Click on the Enable iCloud sync checkbox
Restart the app

data.backup#Backup: iCloud sync will keep all your notes backed up on your iCloud account associated with your apple id. Once enabled, all your notes and folders are seamlessly synced on the server.This feature requires active Internet connection. If your Mac is not connected to the internet, then backup resumes only after your Mac is connected back to the Internet.Your backup will be automatically restored when you set up your new Mac with the same apple id. This feature is helpful if your Mac breaks down or gets stolen.
data.sync-across-devices#Sync across devices:
With iCloud sync, you can keep your notes synced across your Macs.
To enable this, make sure you have enabled iCloud sync on all your Macs.

data:
Ensure iCloud sync is enabled in the Quick Note settings on all devices you wish to sync.
Ensure all devices are online.
Ensure your iCloud storage is not full.
Resolve any Apple ID or iCloud errors on your devices (e.g., sign-in prompts).
Ensure all devices are signed into the same iCloud account.
Try restarting all devices.
Ensure Low Power Mode is not enabled on the devices. It can cause iCloud to delay syncing.
Ensure Quick Note is enabled in “System Settings › Apple ID › iCloud › iCloud Drive › Apps syncing to iCloud Drive”.
Ensure you are on the latest macOS version and Quick Note version.
If it’s a work Mac, make sure there are no restrictions in place that prevents iCloud or iCloud Drive.
If using a VPN, try disconnecting it, as some VPNs can interfere with iCloud syncing.
Check the iCloud system status to ensure the service is not experiencing issues.

Quick Note Pro is a one-time purchase. Once purchased, you can use it foreverIn a rare case, if Quick Note is not able to load your PRO purchase, then it may suggest you to 'Upgrade to Pro'.
In such scenario please consider the following to restore your Purchase
data.restart-the-app#Restart the app:
Open the main menu
Goto More section and click on Quit
Launch Quick Note again.
After launching the app, the 'Upgrade to Pro' prompt should disappear
data.reinstall-the-app#Reinstall the app:
If restarting didn't work, then you can consider reinstalling the app. Reinstalling your app will keep your notes intact.
To reinstall the app
Goto Finder
Goto Applications folder
Delete Quick Note app
Goto App Store and install Quick Note again
data.note#Note:: Solutions mentioned above are applicable only when the PRO version has already been purchased.

Upgrading to PRO removes all the limits imposed in the free version.
data.upgrading-to-pro-gives-you#Upgrading to:
Unlimited notes
Unlimited days of use
iCloud sync
data.how-to-upgrade-to-pro#How to Upgrade to:
Open app menu
Click on 'Upgrade to Pro' to open Purchase window
Click on buy. Confirm the price and approve the transaction
data.is-quick-note-pro-a-subscription#Is Quic: NO. Quick Note Pro is a one-time purchase now and forever
data.note#Note::
You should have appropriate payment enabled in your apple account
For parental permission, you purchase will reflect automatically after approval

data.quick-note-is-not-visible-in-the-menu-ba: If you have a lot of apps in the Menu bar then macOS will manage them by hiding some menubar apps. To fix this, you can quit some existing menubar apps so that there is space for other apps.
data.what-do-i-get-in-the-free-version#What d:
Yes, Quick Note is free to download from on the Mac app store.
In the free version, you can create up to 6 notes and use the app for 30 days
data.what-do-i-get-after-upgrading-to-the-pro: Upgrading to PRO will remove all limits imposed by the free version. Show more details
data.i-have-two-macbooks-can-i-access-the-not: Yes. You can do so by enabling iCloud sync in both the macs.
data.how-can-i-download-the-app-on-iphone#How: Quick Note is only available for Mac. It's not yet available on iPhone, iPad, Android and Windows.
